title: Photo/GraphiK Logo
content:
Hello everyone, I have been a big fan of Typophile for a while now, yet this is my first time posting something.  
I am a photographer but have been taking part in a graphic/web design program.  
We have ben requested to create a business identity for our personal “business”  
I am still debating if I made a good choice with the name but in any case here it is: aRGeBe  
...as in RGB...as in the unification of elements to create a unit/experience yet seen from a slightly different perspective.  
I would greatly appreciate any feedback you could give me with regards to this mark I have been working on...  
I am attempting to portray a dynamic, young, edgy feel to it.  
Color might come into play eventually but as for now....I must figure out the basics of structure/size reductions/spacial relationships and so on.

Thank you for you time.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [aRGeBe.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071119051340/http:/typophile.com/files/aRGeBe.jpg) | 19.14 KB |
author: andresgarcia84

comments.content:
I had played enough with the word “RGB” and had made lots of horrible logos. Although it wasn’t for any studio but here is a link to the original thread.  
 [http://typophile.com/node/28492](http://web.archive.org/web/20071119051340/http:/typophile.com/node/28492 "http://typophile.com/node/28492")

What you should focus on while considering your company’s name is this:  
Who is my target audience?  
What does my company name express to them?  
Unless your target audience are folks in the graphic industry, that name does not say very much. If so, it might be ok. Not my cup of tea, but hey, that’s always subjective.

Good luck.
